diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis and acute pancreatitis secondary to gallstones
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal pain in the LUQ that was acute in onset, associated with nausea and vomiting. Imaging revealed biliary sludge in the gallbladder and peripancreatic stranding consistent with pancreatitis. These findings, along with an elevated lipase level and the patient's history, supported the diagnoses of acute cholecystitis and acute pancreatitis.
